org.apache.gora.cassandra.store

Class CassandraClient<K,T extends PersistentBase>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.gora.cassandra.store.CassandraClient<K,T>
  • Type Parameters:
    K -
    T - 

    public class CassandraClient<K,T extends PersistentBase>
extends Object
    CassandraClient is where all of the primary datastore functionality is executed. Typically CassandraClient is invoked by calling CassandraStore.initialize(Class, Class, Properties). CassandraClient deals with Cassandra data model definition, mutation, and general/specific mappings. CassandraStore.initialize(java.lang.Class<K>, java.lang.Class<T>, java.util.Properties) .

      • initialize

        Method to maintain backward compatibility with earlier versions.
        Parameters:

      • initialize

        public void initialize(Class<K> keyClass,
                       Class<T> persistentClass,
                       Properties properties)
                throws Exception
        Given our key, persistentClass from CassandraStore.initialize(Class, Class, Properties) we make best efforts to dictate our data model. We make a quick check within checkKeyspace() to see if our keyspace has already been invented, this simple check prevents us from recreating the keyspace if it already exists. We then simple specify (based on the input keyclass) an appropriate serializer via GoraSerializerTypeInferer before defining a mutator from and by which we can mutate this object.
        Parameters:
        keyClass - the Key by which we wish o assign a record object
        persistentClass - the generated Persistent bean representing the data.
        properties - key value pairs from gora.properties
        Throws:
        Exception

      • keyspaceExists

        public boolean keyspaceExists()
        Check if keyspace already exists.
        Returns:
        if keyspace already exists return true.

      • checkKeyspace

        public void checkKeyspace()
        Check if keyspace already exists. If not, create it. In this method, we also utilize Hector's ConfigurableConsistencyLevel logic. It is set by passing a ConfigurableConsistencyLevel object right when the Keyspace is created. If we cannot find a consistency level within gora.properites, then column family consistency level is set to QUORUM (by default) which permits consistency to wait for a quorum of replicas to respond regardless of data center. QUORUM is Hector Client's default setting and we respect that here as well.
        See Also:
        Consistency Level

        public void dropKeyspace()
        Drop keyspace.

      • getFamilyMap

        public Map<String,List<String>> getFamilyMap(Query<K,T> query)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        a map which keys are the family names and values the corresponding column names required to get all the query fields.
